item.message: <@U07HKAP46>, <@U03MSAYMY>, <@U1D0W6EVB>, <@U1JF6H4MC>, <@U1K7XHHB8>: This is a nice model for structuring git branches and general workflow. In most of my projects we try to stick with at least the `master` and `develop` branches concept.

item.name: davidh
item.message: FYI everyone (<@U038YQSQN>, <@U03L85HNF>, <@U038Z6LG9>) the cron daemon on metobs01 died. I’ve restarted it.

item.name: brucef
item.message: McV has a lot of good THREDDS and OpenDAP integration

item.name: davidh
item.message: well crap. It seems like a lot of people here are getting in to OGC standards (SOS) and OpenDAP for accessing data and describing sensors (SensorML)

item.name: brucef
item.message: No one around here used it so I just dropped the whole stack

item.name: brucef
item.message: We had constant issues with their Tomcat app running out of memory

item.name: brucef
item.message: 5+ years ago we were running the full Hyrax OpenDAP stack along with a THREDDS server

item.name: davidh
item.message: <@U038YQSQN>: hearing a lot about OpenDAP at AGU and THREDDS: <http://www.unidata.ucar.edu/software/thredds/current/tds/TDS.html>

item.name: davidh
item.message: Yeah maybe. I’ll need to make a decision eventually about how to do frontend stuff for any dashboard-like stuff that I work on. But the more important part of that will probably be pushing data updates for stuff like a realtime meteorogram plot.

item.name: brucef
item.message: We can chat about it more when you get back if you have the interest

item.name: brucef
item.message: All the DOM and data handling is done on the client side by Angular so you won't see it got back to the server when something changes (page refreshes)

item.name: brucef
item.message: For example, here's a really simple Angular app you can get to outside the building: <http://sips.ssec.wisc.edu/archive/availability>

item.name: brucef
item.message: All the data handling is via AJAX style requests.

item.name: davidh
item.message: I guess I don’t know how an angular application is served. It can just be HTML, but do you have plans for AJAX or anything else asynchronous-y

item.name: brucef
item.message: I'm not sure we've decided yet. I think at this point multiple pages/apps per function

item.name: davidh
item.message: I think so

item.name: brucef
item.message: Are you asking if we're going to do a single page app for the entire site or multiple apps per function?

item.name: davidh
item.message: <@U038YQSQN>: do you expect to use it in single page applications or as part of another larger website that happens to have application functionality mixed in? …I’m not sure if that question makes sense.

item.name: davidh
item.message: ok cool

item.name: brucef
item.message: For the SIPS, most, if not all of our upcoming tools will be using Angular

item.name: brucef
item.message: I've done a bunch of stuff in Angular, and thus far it's my goto client side framework

item.name: davidh
item.message: <@U038YQSQN>: how did you feel about Angular?

item.name: davidh
item.message: I copied it to my larch location

item.name: davidh
item.message: I’m at AGU in San Francisco and can’t access that server. I’ll have to try later.

item.name: davidh
item.message: <@U038YQSQN>: FYI <@U04LDJXDC> pointed out that the HSRL quicklooks on the GAMIS site are pointing to the wrong HSRL. The quicklooks are of the HSRL that is currently in the SPARC trailer (bagoHSRL), but the one on the roof is currently aHSRL. I talked to Joe Garcia and the `site` parameter in the URL needs to be changed to 29 instead of 13. It looks like this is set in the old metobs hsrl package (not sure if its still this way) in metobs/instruments/gvhsrl/__init__.py:SITE. Would you like me to try to tackle this? I haven’t looked at the current install for a long time.
